snippet.textDisplay: +Vera Enning I cant imagine the game will live up.  My favorite systems of all time was the SNES (partially because i was 11 when i got one so prime gaming years as a kid) but GCN was a my favorite 3d system.  From ps3 on ....its different now, there are less companies making games, more indies yes, but it just feels different to me (not bad, just different) I guess internet connectivity for systems has changed them for me.  Who knows, maybe im just feeling old.

I don't think your english is that bad actually.
I understand wholly the whole games in "our world" thing, I feel the same way.
Your friend needs to be a bit more open to possibilities is all I can say. It'd be nice if all language patches could exist for every game but some languages are bound to be more popular, can't let that keep you from something you could possibly enjoy. I'll even use broken Google translate if need be. XD

snippet.textDisplay: And she just said why: "Look, my English is not that good, this is why I don't really watch the story of english games, the only exception is that if it has a Hungarian patch." I've just told her that not only graphics are gameplay, the gameplay is the story, the world you could "live in", the fantasy part of it, the possibilities. (Sorry I don't really like games which are about "our world" (GTA, L.A Noire, etc.)) But no, never wants to give it a try. -.-" WHY, WHYYYYY?????????

snippet.textDisplay:
Well I'm sorry to say, but your friend's ability to judge quality is absolutely terrible. Horrendous. Unless your friend can see the future, raise the dead, walk on water, loves Chrono Trigger, or has spoken with God about possibly being the next incarnation of Jesus himself, I'm not sure if I personally would trust a single opinion of theirs if to dictate a game they go solely on graphics and they deem cell shading as instant "ugly".
Because that is a terrible judge of quality.
snippet.textOriginal:
Well I'm sorry to say, but your friend's ability to judge quality is absolutely terrible. Horrendous. Unless your friend can see the future, raise the dead, walk on water, loves Chrono Trigger, or has spoken with God about possibly being the next incarnation of Jesus himself, I'm not sure if I personally would trust a single opinion of theirs if to dictate a game they go solely on graphics and they deem cell shading as instant "ugly".
Because that is a terrible judge of quality.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well, a friend of mine doesn't want to play it because "the graphics are ugly".
That was very bad for me to hear this, it's my childhood favourite. :') Even today when I play it, if I see the Lighthouse, Pey'j, or when I can drive the hovercraft on the sea of Hyllis, I'm jst smiling and remembering that wow, the best game I played ever. The only game what I can't find boring... Since 2005. (Yes, I only played the game first in 2005) Those good old times. Hyllis, what I can call "my second home".
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Man, I can't tell you how often I see loads of used copies of this sitting around for $8 each. And how no one buys them is beyond me.
As to the sequel, it is VERY possible. For god's sake we're in the reinventing/FPS/sandbox generation! Rocket Knight got redone, Megaman, Punch Out!!, I've actually posted a similar comment elsewhere as well. Point is, no series is ever truly dead. Gaming series as a whole are about 30 years old, so if 20 year old games are returning, this one definetly will too.
snippet.textOriginal:
Man, I can't tell you how often I see loads of used copies of this sitting around for $8 each. And how no one buys them is beyond me.
As to the sequel, it is VERY possible. For god's sake we're in the reinventing/FPS/sandbox generation! Rocket Knight got redone, Megaman, Punch Out!!, I've actually posted a similar comment elsewhere as well. Point is, no series is ever truly dead. Gaming series as a whole are about 30 years old, so if 20 year old games are returning, this one definetly will too.

snippet.textDisplay: had this game in my shelves for years. got it with a game collection (Gold Games 8). Trying it now and I am REALLY surprised how original and fun it is. If there's more ppl out there who are sick of playing the new always-the-same-thing games. This is definitely worth a try :)
snippet.textOriginal: had this game in my shelves for years. got it with a game collection (Gold Games 8). Trying it now and I am REALLY surprised how original and fun it is. snippet.textDisplay: One of the, if not *THE*, best "Game that nobody played." Epic story, great characters, awesome art direction, tight controls, and, of course, incredible soundtrack. I play it through at least four times a year and wish it had sold better so that a sequel could have been made T_T
snippet.textOriginal: One of the, if not *THE*, best "Game that nobody played." Epic story, great characters, awesome art direction, tight controls, and, of course, incredible soundtrack. I play it through at least four times a year and wish it had sold better so that a sequel could have been made T_T

It does look pretty though.

snippet.textDisplay:
That's a very good choice. It's an amazing game, really (in my top two favorites). Buy it.

But before you go thinking it's a "peaceful, pretty" game, I'd watch a couple of official trailers for it. It's a little more dark than this song portrays is as--but I love it anyway! Wonderful game!
snippet.textOriginal:
That's a very good choice. It's an amazing game, really (in my top two favorites). Buy it.

But before you go thinking it's a "peaceful, pretty" game, I'd watch a couple of official trailers for it. It's a little more dark than this song portrays is as--but I love it anyway! Wonderful game!
